attributes.action: Abuse/Violence to retail staff to be a standalone criminal offence.
attributes.additional_details:
Looking at the stats on British Retail Consortium for 2022/23: survey shows a 50% increase in levels of retail violence and abuse, to 1300 incidents a day.

60% of respondents say police response is “poor” or “very poor”.

Putting retail abuse as a standalone criminal offence should in effect lower the amount of incidents per day with police having a better response.

Less employees will go off sick/stressed and fell safe on their working environment. Retail abuse can have a long term effect on people’s mental health.

Make the difference to make retail workers feel safe.
attributes.background: To make violence or abuse against retail staff a standalone criminal offence. To reduce crime in the town/city centres and make a stand against criminals and give strong signals to the victims.

rejection.details:
In November 2024, the Policing Minister announced that the new specific offence of assaulting a shopworker would have a maximum prison sentence of six months. 

Perpetrators would also face an unlimited fine and a ban from the shop where they committed the offence.
